Initialize a TopologyÂ¶

The Joint objects in a Topology can be articulated to define the initial configuration you want to use for your simulation.

You can access the Joint objects in a Topology through the Topology.joints attribute. Since Topology can only be a kinematic tree, each Joint is uniquely indexed by its child body.

Setting the configuration of a Joint in the way you want requires knowing the representation used by the Joint. For all the joints included in default pynamics, this is listed in the Notes section under each joints documentation (see pynamics.kinematics.joint).

To set an initial articulation and joint-space velocity of a Joint, we use Joint.set_configuration and Joint.set_configuration_d respectively.

For example, to articulate the FreeJoint from oue example by +1m in X, and add an initial velocity of +1 m/s in Y:

topology.joints["Cube"].set_configuration(1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0)
topology.joints["Cube"].set_configuration_d(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0)
